content.raw:
a nicer way to do this is to provide an entry point.

From docker docs: "If you would like your container to run the same executable every time, then you should consider using ENTRYPOINT in combination with CMD. See ENTRYPOINT."

Example here: https://github.com/osrf/docker_images/tree/master/ros/lunar/ubuntu/xenial/ros-core
content.html:
a nicer way to do this is to provide an entry point.

Example here: https://github.com/osrf/docker_images/tree/master/ros/lunar/ubuntu/xenial/ros-core

update.description:
In `servicesim/docker` folder, Do:

`$ ./build.sh` to build the image,

`$ ./run.sh` to run the docker container.

 Can be tested by running, `roslaunch servicesim servicesim.launch

content.raw: If we install an editor it should be vim as it seems to be the default one used by the ROS tools. I just realized that it's not install in the ROS image for some reason. I'll fix it but I think we should put it here because it will take time before being approved and the images rebuilt
content.html: If we install an editor it should be vim as it seems to be the default one used by the ROS tools. I just realized that it's not install in the ROS image for some reason. I'll fix it but I think we should put it here because it will take time before being approved and the images rebuilt

content.raw: please remove the apt cache to avoid storing it in every layer of the image (this makes images pretty big at the end of the day). We should remove the lists after each apt update call, example here: https://github.com/osrf/docker_images/blob/40903f632eca1bf5fef2c8420511b3ddc9c4409b/ros/kinetic/ubuntu/xenial/desktop/Dockerfile#L8
content.html: please remove the apt cache to avoid storing it in every layer of the image (this makes images pretty big at the end of the day). We should remove the lists after each apt update call, example here: https://github.com/osrf/docker_images/blob/40903f632eca1bf5fef2c8420511b3ddc9c4409b/ros/kinetic/ubuntu/xenial/desktop/Dockerfile#L8
